dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2023, the Trump brothers really went all-in on that Bahamas casino project for $50 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty twenty three, the Trump brothers really went all-in on that Bahamas casino project for fifty dollars million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But their planstorm into Americas heartland with two new licensed hotel brandsdied earlier this year after failing to gain traction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a total reversal from their father's pledge to avoid international expansion, right? And they did it just months after the election loss.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a total reversal from their father's pledge to avoid international expansion, right? And they did it just months after the election loss.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Dominican Republic, the younger Trumps sold a piece of land in January 2018 for $3.2 million. It was the clearest violation of their fathers pledge to do no new foreign deals while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then there's the fast food chain—Don Jr. and Eric were uh, proclaiming they'd create the best fast food the world has ever known.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then there's the fast food chain-Don Jr. and Eric were uh, proclaiming they'd create the best fast food the world has ever known.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Added Don Jr.: When politics are over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious properties in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild, considering how much debt they were piling on. Like, half a billion dollars in new business deals since the election?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild, considering how much debt they were piling on. Like, half a billion dollars in new business deals since the election?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Over 500 transactions, actually. And some of them are just… strange. Buying a Beverly Hills mansion from a company tied to Iran's leader? That's gonna raise eyebrows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Over five hundred transactions, actually. And some of them are just... strange. Buying a Beverly Hills mansion from a company tied to Iran's leader? That's gonna raise eyebrows.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since their fathers inauguration, they have sold off $110 million of the presidents real estate holdingsthrough more than 100 tiny transactions that have mostly flown under the radar. They sold Trumps mansion in Beverly Hills for $13.5 million to a company tied to Indonesian billionaire (and Trump business partner) Hary Tanoesoedibjo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And then there's that federally subsidized housing deal—they made an estimated $330 million profit buying it from their own company?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And then there's that federally subsidized housing deal-they made an estimated three hundred thirty dollars million profit buying it from their own company?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That put Trumps subordinate in the awkward position of having to green-light a transaction that paid his boss an estimated $33 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: While Ben Carson was opposing it! It's just such a tangled web. And they're not even selling much—just tearing down Trump Tower and selling one office building in San Francisco.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: While Ben Carson was opposing it! It's just such a tangled web. And they're not even selling much-just tearing down Trump Tower and selling one office building in San Francisco.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Secretary of Housing & Urban Development Ben Carson had to give his approval to make the deal happen, according to property records. Trump Tower got minor updates, a five-story San Francisco office building got a face-lift and the Trumps keep stuffing cash into their money-losing European golf resorts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, they keep buying—golf courses, luxury hotels, even a $100 million condo from their cousin Maryanne Trump Barry.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, they keep buying-golf courses, luxury hotels, even a one hundred dollars million condo from their cousin Maryanne Trump Barry.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But theyve really made only one new purchase, buying an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lagofrom their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry. They arent snapping up new golf courses or hotels, and fellow New York City real estate titans have noticed the presidents absence in the Big Apple.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And all this debt they're taking on… like $600 million added since the election? It feels like they're trying to rebuild the empire but with way more risk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all this debt they're taking on... like six hundred dollars million added since the election? It feels like they're trying to rebuild the empire but with way more risk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that $300 million Las Vegas loan they took out and then refused to pay back after failing to sell condos? That's just reckless.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that three hundred dollars million Las Vegas loan they took out and then refused to pay back after failing to sell condos? That's just reckless.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In late 2016, Trump took out a $30 million loan against a Las Vegas tower he owns with fellow billionaire Phil Ruffinperhaps freeing up some cash for the candidates $12 million in last-minute campaign donations. After selling dozens of condos in the building, the Trumps repaid that loan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You wonder how much of this is just burning through what's left of the fortune. The article mentioned the president's net worth dropped by a billion after he lost.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You wonder how much of this is just burning through what's left of the fortune. The article mentioned the president's net worth dropped by a billion after he lost.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president is worth $3.1 billion (good for No. 275 on The Forbes 400), the same as a year ago and down $400 million from when he took office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, down to a paltry $100 million. So maybe the kids are trying to make up for it, but it seems like they're digging a deeper hole.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, down to a paltry one hundred dollars million. So maybe the kids are trying to make up for it, but it seems like they're digging a deeper hole.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president is worth $3.1 billion (good for No. 275 on The Forbes 400), the same as a year ago and down $400 million from when he took office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And with authorities already paying attention to all these deals… it's a risky game they're playing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And with authorities already paying attention to all these deals... it's a risky game they're playing.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in 2023, the Trump brothers really went all-in on that Bahamas casino project for $50 million.
HostB: Yeah, a total reversal from their father’s pledge to avoid international expansion, right? And they did it just months after the election loss.
HostA: Exactly. And then there’s the fast food chain—Don Jr. and Eric were uh, proclaiming they’d create the best fast food the world has ever known.
HostB: Which is wild, considering how much debt they were piling on. Like, half a billion dollars in new business deals since the election?
HostA: Over 500 transactions, actually. And some of them are just… strange. Buying a Beverly Hills mansion from a company tied to Iran’s leader? That’s gonna raise eyebrows.
HostB: For sure. And then there’s that federally subsidized housing deal—they made an estimated $330 million profit buying it from their own company?
HostA: While Ben Carson was opposing it! It’s just such a tangled web. And they’re not even selling much—just tearing down Trump Tower and selling one office building in San Francisco.
HostB: Meanwhile, they keep buying—golf courses, luxury hotels, even a $100 million condo from their cousin Maryanne Trump Barry.
HostA: And all this debt they’re taking on… like $600 million added since the election? It feels like they’re trying to rebuild the empire but with way more risk.
HostB: Yeah, and that $300 million Las Vegas loan they took out and then refused to pay back after failing to sell condos? That’s just reckless.
HostA: You wonder how much of this is just burning through what’s left of the fortune. The article mentioned the president’s net worth dropped by a billion after he lost.
HostB: Right, down to a paltry $100 million. So maybe the kids are trying to make up for it, but it seems like they’re digging a deeper hole.
HostA: And with authorities already paying attention to all these deals… it’s a risky game they’re playing.
